intro: Erdisia melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired erdisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, black, spherical fruits. Erdisia melanotricha is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
